## Description {#details}

Defines the fixed point number interface.

This is a class for abstracting various operations performed on fixed point types.

<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Returns true if this fixed-point semantic with its value bits interpreted</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// as an integer can fit in the given floating point semantic without</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// overflowing to infinity.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// For example, a signed 8-bit fixed-point semantic has a maximum and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// minimum integer representation of 127 and -128, respectively. If both of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// these values can be represented (possibly inexactly) in the floating</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// point semantic without overflowing, this returns true.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="100"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/fixedpointsemantics/#ab30aaf95486d0b2aac87f3d9e1e450e3">fitsInFloatSemantics</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/fltsemantics">fltSemantics</a> &amp;FloatSema) </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00155" /><CodeLine lineNumber="155"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00156" /><CodeLine lineNumber="156"><Highlight kind="comment">/// The APFixedPoint class works similarly to APInt/APSInt in that it is a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00157" /><CodeLine lineNumber="157"><Highlight kind="comment">/// functional replacement for a scaled integer. It supports a wide range of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00158" /><CodeLine lineNumber="158"><Highlight kind="comment">/// semantics including the one used by fixed point types proposed in ISO/IEC</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00159" /><CodeLine lineNumber="159"><Highlight kind="comment">/// JTC1 SC22 WG14 N1169. The class carries the value and semantics of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00160" /><CodeLine lineNumber="160"><Highlight kind="comment">/// a fixed point, and provides different operations that would normally be</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00161" /><CodeLine lineNumber="161"><Highlight kind="comment">/// performed on fixed point types.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00162" /><CodeLine lineNumber="162" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apfixedpoint"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apfixedpoint/#a17de6476b95be00e26e2a67b4bdd105f">APFixedPoint</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00163" /><CodeLine lineNumber="163"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">public</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00164" /><CodeLine lineNumber="164" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apfixedpoint/#a17de6476b95be00e26e2a67b4bdd105f"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apfixedpoint/#a17de6476b95be00e26e2a67b4bdd105f">APFixedPoint</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint">APInt</a> &amp;Val, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/fixedpointsemantics">FixedPointSemantics</a> &amp;Sema)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00165" /><CodeLine lineNumber="165"><Highlight kind="normal">      : Val(Val, !Sema.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apfixedpoint/#a9a5c35033396ab686cf586ebdd083dbe">isSigned</a>()), Sema(Sema) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00166" /><CodeLine lineNumber="166"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(Val.getBitWidth() == Sema.getWidth() &amp;&amp;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00167" /><CodeLine lineNumber="167"><Highlight kind="normal">           </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;The value should have a bit width that matches the Sema width&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00172" /><CodeLine lineNumber="172"><Highlight kind="normal">                           </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">/&#42;implicitTrunc=&#42;/</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/basicaliasanalysis-cpp/#af6d5cafbdfc5313e65d990120021a3ec">true</a>),</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00175" /><CodeLine lineNumber="175"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Zero initialization.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00176" /><CodeLine lineNumber="176" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apfixedpoint/#a6c1242c6135519977403a4e241c0c91a"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apfixedpoint/#a6c1242c6135519977403a4e241c0c91a">APFixedPoint</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/fixedpointsemantics">FixedPointSemantics</a> &amp;Sema) : <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apfixedpoint/#a17de6476b95be00e26e2a67b4bdd105f">APFixedPoint</a>(0, Sema) &#123;&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
